texto: As part of the project various improvements to other roads were built totalling more than 37 kms of upgraded infrastructures for the benefit of the local drivers.

The M3 motorway project is executed in an area that basically corresponds to farmland (grazing land) in which hedges and lines of trees, which along with marsh areas and river crossings (Tolka, Boyne or Blackwater) make up the areas of greatest ecological value.

A complete revegetation programme covering the worksite has been carried out, which includes planting of bushes and trees and hydroseeding, apart from complementary protection systems against erosion, such as geo-cells, organic erosion control blankets or special projection of mulch.
The project includes two Toll Plazas with administration and maintenance buildings (Blackbull Toll Plaza and Grange Toll Plaza).
